title: Man and Woman Killed, 2 Others Wounded in South L.A. Shooting: Police
content:
You need to have the Adobe Flash Player to view this content. Please click here to continue.
A man and a woman were killed and two men were wounded Saturday evening in a shooting outside a South L.A. liquor store, authorities said.
Officers responded about 8:15 p.m. to a report of a shooting involving an AK-47 assault rifle in the area of East 81st Street and Avalon Boulevard, in the Florence neighborhood, a Los Angeles Police Department sergeant said.
They arrived to find four people who who had been struck by gunfire -- three men and a woman -- one of whom was pronounced dead at the scene, according to the LAPD spokesman.
The three other victims were transported from the scene to a hospital, said Erik Scott, spokesman for the Los Angeles Fire Department.
One of the patients died at the medical center, police said. The conditions of the two surviving men were unknown.
None of the victims were immediately identified.
A witness described the incident as a drive-by shooting, in which at least 13 shots were fired from a white vehicle.
"I ducked," Eduard Emerson told KTLA. "As long as I can hear the gunshots, I'm alright. You can't live but once."
The area outside the Three Star Liquor Market on Avalon Boulevard was taped off as an investigation was underway.
No description of the shooter was available.
Correction: An earlier version of this article erroneously reported the location of the shooting. The post has been updated.
